column2: Yet always, I feel obligated\nto respond, and seek her out.
column3: 我直觉...我有呼应\n那个呼唤的义务。\n

column2: <!empty>
...So I wander. Both in my\ndream, and in reality...
column3: ...这种感觉一直驱散不去。

column2: I am indebted to you, Adol.
column3: 亚特鲁先生，谢谢你的帮忙。

column2: We don't have much to offer,\nbut you may think of this\nhouse as your own home.
column3: 不好意思，家里没什么可以招待的，\n您请慢慢休息吧。

column2: I swear, what is\nLuta thinking?!
column3: 卢达真是的，\n一点也不懂得别人的心情...！

column2: How can he say not to\nworry, when he KNOWS\nhe'll sleepwalk again?!
column3: 『我估计我还会再梦游，不过\n我会想办法回来的，你不用担心。』\n...竟然说那种话...。

column2: I may need to tie him to\nthe bed tonight. And leave\nhim that way, this time...
column3: 啊，我好不安啊...\n也许我该把他绑在床上才对？

column2: A refreshing breeze drifted up from\nthe plains and gently shook the\nleaves at the top of the Great Tree.
column3: \n凉风筝过草原\n温柔地摇动大树的树稍。

column2: Here, no monsters could be heard.\nOnly the sound of rustling leaves.
column3: \n四周没有魔物的气息，\n只听见树叶摩擦的声音。

column2: A refreshing breeze drifted up from\nthe plains and gently shook the\nleaves at the top of the Great Tree.
column3: \n凉风筝过草原\n温柔地摇动大树的树梢。

column2: It almost sounded like a soft\nvoice, blending in with the\nsound of the wind.
column3: \n在风的声响之中，\n混杂着不知是谁的低声细语。

column2: A refreshing breeze drifted up from\nthe plains and gently shook the\nleaves at the top of the Great Tree.
column3: \n凉风筝过草原\n温柔地摇动大树的树梢。

column2: The wind sounded almost as though\nit were talking to Adol.
column3: \n在风的声响之中\n有个声音在向亚特鲁倾诉。

column2: Silver light began to spill out\nfrom the roots of the Great Tree.
column3: 大树的根部发出银色光芒。

column2: A refreshing breeze drifted up from\nthe plains and gently shook the\nleaves at the top of the Great Tree.
column3: \n凉风筝过草原\n温柔地摇动大树的树梢。

column2: The mysterious voice could\nbe heard no longer...
column3: \n那不可思议的声音\n已经消失...。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Whoa!
column3: 啊！

column2: Don't scare me like that. I\nthought you were a monster...
column3: 啊，别吓我。\n我还以为是魔物的士兵呢...

column2: I haven't seen another human in\nquite some time... You're not in\ncahoots with the evil ones, are you?
column3: 我好像从没见过你...\n你不是那些魔物的同伴吧？

column2: <!empty>
Good, good. Then you're welcome to\nstay here and take refuge with me,\nif you'd like.
column3: 这么危险的地方\n真亏你有办法跑进来。

column2: Won't be great company for you,\nthough, I'm afraid. I have matters\nof my own to attend to!
column3: ...抱歉，\n我很忙，没时间陪你讲话。

column2: I've lost something extremely\nimportant to me, and I won't\nrest until I've found it.
column3: 大事不好了，\n重要的物品不见了...

column2: Wha...?! That's my idol!
column3: 哦哦哦...！\n那个不是我的偶像吗！

column2: I see, so Dogi asked you to\nbring it to me? Much obliged!
column3: 原来是多奇拜托你的吗。\n谢谢你专程送来给我。

column2: My name is Raba. I'm a seeker\nof ancient knowledge. A scholar\nby trade, if you will.
column3: 我的名字叫做拉巴。

column2: I came here six months ago to\nstudy the ancient ruins of\nEsteria.
column3: 勉强可以算是一名学者。\n半年前为了调查古代遗迹，\n跨海来到艾斯塔里亚的。

column2: But while I was investigating\nthis tower, monsters suddenly\ncame from every which way.
column3: 很不巧，就在这里进行调查的时候，\n突然冒出一大堆的魔物。

column2: So I've been hiding out in here,\nhoping they wouldn't find me.
column3: 然后我就被关在这里面了。

column2: This Idol has been my saving\ngrace. It may not look like\nmuch, but it's full of power!
column3: ...这个偶像是我唯一的依靠。\n它隐藏着很多神奇的力量哦。

column2: <!empty>
When held close to the body,\nit can make you completely\nvanish from sight.
column3: 随身携带着它，\n可以把自己的气息完全消除掉。

column2: It's the reason I've been able\nto survive for so long without\nthe monsters finding me.
column3: 托这个东西的福，\n我才能够活到今天呀。

column2: ...Well, young man? What brings\nYOU to this dreadful place?
column3: ...好了，换你说了，年轻人。\n你为什么要来这个塔？

column2: Your equipment suggests you came\nhere knowing of its dangers. So I\nassume you have a reason.
column3: 从你的装备来看，你是有备而来的。\n你的这里应该是有什么目的的吧？

column2: Adol explained that he entered Darm\nTower in search of the Books of Ys.
column3: \n亚特鲁说出自己\n进入达姆之塔的原因，是为了寻找伊苏之书。

column2: I see...
That was going to be my first\nguess, actually!
column3: 果然是这样啊！

column2: The name Ys appears quite\nfrequently in ancient texts\neven on the mainland.
column3: 『伊苏』这个名字在大陆流传的古文书里面\n也经常出现。

column2: They say it's a land adept in the\npowers of magic, with an abundant\nsupply of a silver-like metal.
column3: 那是因称为『魔法』的神奇力量\n与像白银一样闪亮的金属，而繁极一时的国家。

column2: But as time went on, the name\nsimply...vanished from history.\nNo one mentioned it anymore.
column3: 但是古代王国『伊苏』的名字\n却以某个时期为分界点，在历史上消声匿迹。

column2: Nowadays, no one even knows\nwhere on the map to find it!
column3: 如今\n都还没有人知道伊苏究竟存在什么地方。

column2: It's a name we scholars always\nfigured belonged to some long-\nlost utopian land of legend.
column3: 我们学者之间\n也只是把它定义为\n理想国之类的传说之一。

column2: But I always knew Ys was somewhere\nin Esteria. I had a hunch, anyway.\nAnd it would seem I was correct!
column3: 但是，那个『伊苏国』真的存在。\n它真的曾经存在艾斯塔里亚这块土地上。\n我的假设是正确的...！

column2: If I've got it figured right, then\nsomething akin to the Stormwall\nappeared on the day Ys was lost.
column3: ...依照少数记录伊苏国消失的文献记载\n那个时候也曾经发生类似『岚之结界』的现象。

column2: Storms encircled the island, and\nwhen they were gone, so was Ys. All\nthat remained was this here tower.
column3: 当长达几年的岚之结界消失后，\n『伊苏国』就完全消失无踪，荒废的地表\n只矗立着高耸入天的巨塔。

column2: Esteria's minstrels tell of swarms\nof monsters killing off half the\nland's people in a single night.
column3: 依据艾斯塔里亚口耳相传的传说...\n当时魔物大军突然出现，蹂躏伊苏全境。\n尔后，国土跟一半以上的人民竟然在一夜之间蒸发不见。

column2: Nobody could get away, either, on\naccount of the storms. Meanwhile,\nthe monsters built Darm Tower.
column3: 然后，留下来的魔物就建造起了\n这个『达姆之塔』。

column2: Then, right after the tower was\ncompleted, the monsters all just\ndisappeared. The crisis had passed.
column3: 当巨塔完成后没多久，\n魔物们也消失不见，灾难到此告一段落。

column2: Several hundred years passed, and\nin that time, the whole mess was\nforgotten. Well, mostly, anyway.
column3: 从那以后，数百年的岁月过去了...\n这块土地上的人们也忘记了过去的灾难。

column2: But the danger was still there.\nIt was dormant...but it was there.
column3: ...其实灾难\n并没有真正结束。

column2: You sense it, too, don't you? As we\nspeak, someone in this tower is\nsetting something evil in motion.
column3: 你应该也有感觉到吧？\n现在这座塔似乎有受到人为的控制。

column2: There are traps everywhere around\nhere. Without a doubt, someone or\nsomething is puppeteering it all.
column3: 被统率的魔物士兵、以及邪恶的机关...\n不会错的，背后一定有人在操纵。

column2: <!empty>
To what end, though, I have no\nidea. But we can't just let it\nhappen, can we?
column3: 他的目的究竟是什么...\n这个有必要去探查清楚。

column2: <!empty>
...Of course, that's why you're\nhere, though. So, you intend to\nkeep climbing this tower, do you?
column3: ...话说回来，\n你真的打算就这个样子探索下去吗？

column2: In that case, I think you should\nhave this.
column3: 这样吧，你把这东西带着走。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
As long as you're wearing the Blue\nNecklace, the tower's many booby\ntraps will be totally ineffective.
column3: 那个项链有除魔的力量。\n可以保护你不误中邪恶的机关。

column2: Now, if you'll excuse me...I have\na few things I need to ponder. You\ngo on ahead, all right?
column3: ...不好意思，\n我想安静思考事情。

column2: When Adol came to, he found\nhimself locked in a prison\ncell.
column3: 醒过来的时候，人已经在牢房里面了。

column2: He checked his belongings and\nfound that some were missing!
column3: 亚特鲁确认自己的装备。\n ...发现携带的物品\n有些已经没有了。

column2: When Adol came to, he was once\nagain in a prison cell. It seems\nhe wasn't paying much attention!
column3: 醒过来时，又再度回到牢房里面了。

column2: As expected, his silver equipment\nwas missing, just as it was last\ntime. How embarrassing for him!
column3: 装备又被人翻过的样子。

column2: There seemed to be no one at all\nout in the corridor.
column3: 渠道上，\n没发现移动的物体。

column2: The bars were strong, and\nshaking them appeared to be\na wasted effort.
column3: 铁栏杆很坚固，\n摇都摇不动。

column2: There was no door, as far as\nAdol could tell.
column3: 找不到门之类的物体。

column2: The walls were made of heavy\nstone, and covered with a\nthick layer of damp dust.
column3: 这是石头组成的严密的墙壁。\n上面沾有潮湿的污垢。

column2: There was no window or drain.\nThe room was quite stuffy.
column3: 看不到窗户和排水沟。\n也感觉不到空气的流动。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
...So, you're finally awake.
column3: ...你醒来了。

column2: Pleasure to meet you. My name\nis Luta Gemma. I'm a poet from\nZepik Village.
column3: 你好，初次幸会。\n我是住在塞皮克村的居民，\n我叫卢达·洁玛。

column2: How did I get here? Well, you might\nnot believe this...but it actually\nseems as if I sleepwalked here!
column3: 说来挺难为情的，\n我有梦游症的毛病，\n等我醒来的时候，已经在塔里迷路了。

column2: When I woke up, I found myself\nsurrounded by monsters, and\nscrambled to get away from them.
column3: 我已经努力的逃啊，躲啊，\n想尽办法不让魔物士兵找到我，可是...。

column2: <!empty>
But it was no use. They caught me.\nOnly, instead of killing me...they\nthrew me in here!
column3: 一下子就被抓起来...\n关到这个地下牢里头。

column2: Fancy meeting you in a place\nlike this, eh, Adol?
column3: 亚特鲁先生...。\n没想到会在这地方跟你碰面...。

column2: I'm ashamed to confirm that yes,\nI sleepwalked here. Somehow.
column3: 我可能是梦游的毛病又发作了，\n等我醒过来的时候，已经在塔中迷路了。

column2: <!empty>
...Wait, so you came in here BY\nCHOICE? I'm...flabbergasted! Why\nin the world would you do that?!
column3: 亚特鲁先生，\n你是自己选择进入这座塔的吗？\n你真的是...很爱冒险的人啊。

column2: You certainly don't LOOK out of\nyour mind. Actually, you look...\nsure of yourself. Completely.
column3: 不过我觉得很不可思议。\n你的眼中一丝毫的迷惑都没有。

column2: Admittedly, it takes a brave man\nto walk through that tower door of\nhis own accord. I salute you, sir!
column3: 跟我不一样，我是不知受到什么力量的引导，\n你是凭自己的意思决定来这里的...\n我可以感受到你的坚强。

column2: Oh, yeah. Ran into someone else in\nhere, too. Or rather, I saw him,\nbriefly, as I fled for dear life!
column3: ...对了，除了我以外，\n好像还有别人也在这座塔里面。

column2: I was in a passage with a row of\nstatues, and saw an old man holding\nsomething. But then, he disappeared!
column3: 被魔物抓到之前，我在很多石像排列的地方\n看到一个持杖的老者。\n后来走在渠道的半途中时，又跟丢了...。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Howdy, stranger! Don't worry-- I come\nin peace!
column3: 年轻人，我来帮助你了。

column2: Dogi's the name, and wall-crushing's my\ngame. Pleased to meet ya'!
column3: 我叫做多奇。请多多指教！

column2: Let's save the chit-chat for later,\nthough. We gotta get the hell out of\nhere!
column3: 详情以后再说，\n总之赶快逃出这里吧。
